docs.abstract: Mr. Chauvin, the former Minneapolis police officer, may choose to speak at his hearing. He could face decades in prison.
docs.snippet: Mr. Chauvin, the former Minneapolis police officer, may choose to speak at his hearing. He could face decades in prison.
docs.lead_paragraph: MINNEAPOLIS — For the past two months, Derek Chauvin has been held in solitary confinement as lawyers and investigators have been busy with the next phase of his case: determining the length of his punishment for the murder of George Floyd.

headline.main: Derek Chauvin, held in solitary confinement, returns to the courtroom to learn his fate.

docs.abstract: Mr. Chauvin delivered brief remarks at his sentencing hearing but said he could not say more because he still faced additional charges in George Floyd’s death.
docs.snippet: Mr. Chauvin delivered brief remarks at his sentencing hearing but said he could not say more because he still faced additional charges in George Floyd’s death.
docs.lead_paragraph: Derek Chauvin spoke directly to George Floyd’s family for the first time on Friday, telling them in brief remarks at his sentencing hearing that he wanted to “give my condolences” but that he could not say more because he still faced charges in Mr. Floyd’s death.

headline.main: ‘I want to give my condolences to the Floyd family,’ Derek Chauvin says at his sentencing hearing.

docs.abstract: The vandalism came just days after the statue was unveiled, and only a day before the officer who killed Mr. Floyd was to be sentenced.
docs.snippet: The vandalism came just days after the statue was unveiled, and only a day before the officer who killed Mr. Floyd was to be sentenced.
docs.lead_paragraph: A statue of George Floyd that was installed in Brooklyn less than a week ago was spray-painted and marked with a white supremacist group’s logo in an act of vandalism that the police were investigating as a hate crime, officials said on Thursday.

headline.main: George Floyd Statue in Brooklyn Is Defaced With Hate Group’s Symbol
headline.print_headline: In Brooklyn, New Statue of Floyd Is Defaced With Symbol of a White Supremacist Group

docs.abstract: Mr. Chauvin, 45, had been a police officer with the Minneapolis Police Department for more than 19 years before George Floyd’s death and had been the subject of at least 22 complaints and investigations.
docs.snippet: Mr. Chauvin, 45, had been a police officer with the Minneapolis Police Department for more than 19 years before George Floyd’s death and had been the subject of at least 22 complaints and investigations.
docs.lead_paragraph: Derek Chauvin, 45, had been a police officer with the Minneapolis Police Department for more than 19 years before George Floyd’s death. During that time, he was the subject of at least 22 complaints and internal investigations. One of the episodes led to two letters of reprimand — his only formal discipline.

headline.main: What do we know about Derek Chauvin?

docs.abstract: Carolyn Pawlenty told a judge that she believed he was innocent. Mr. Chauvin offered condolences to George Floyd’s family.
docs.snippet: Carolyn Pawlenty told a judge that she believed he was innocent. Mr. Chauvin offered condolences to George Floyd’s family.
docs.lead_paragraph: Derek Chauvin’s mother, speaking publicly for the first time, said in court on Friday that her son had wrongly been described as a racist and that she believed he was innocent of murdering George Floyd.

headline.main: Derek Chauvin’s mother, speaking for the first time, says her son ‘is a good man.’

docs.abstract: Some scenes near Cup Foods are now very familiar — prayers, pictures, conversations — while others, like traffic, are new.
docs.snippet: Some scenes near Cup Foods are now very familiar — prayers, pictures, conversations — while others, like traffic, are new.
docs.lead_paragraph: MINNEAPOLIS — Some scenes at George Floyd Square in Minneapolis are now very familiar. Some people pray, others take pictures and some have conversations about where things stand.

headline.main: At George Floyd Square, traffic now mixes with the memorials.

docs.abstract: Friday’s hearing will be streamed live from the courtroom.
docs.snippet: Friday’s hearing will be streamed live from the courtroom.
docs.lead_paragraph: Derek Chauvin, the former police officer who was convicted of murdering George Floyd on a Minneapolis street corner last year, will be sentenced for the crime on Friday at 1:30 p.m. Central.

headline.main: How to watch the Derek Chauvin sentencing.

docs.abstract: President Donald Trump never invoked the act, but fresh details underscore the intensity of his interest last June in using active-duty military to curb unrest.
docs.snippet: President Donald Trump never invoked the act, but fresh details underscore the intensity of his interest last June in using active-duty military to curb unrest.
docs.lead_paragraph: Responding to interest from President Donald J. Trump, White House aides drafted a proclamation last year to invoke the Insurrection Act in case Mr. Trump moved to take the extraordinary step of deploying active-duty troops in Washington to quell the protests that followed the killing of George Floyd, two senior Trump administration officials said.

headline.main: Trump Aides Prepared Insurrection Act Order During Debate Over Protests
headline.print_headline: Trump Weighed Insurrection Act Amid Protests

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

byline.original: By Michael S. Schmidt and Maggie Haberman

docs.abstract: Economists are grappling with how much to blame bias or a changing economy for the widening wage gap over the last 40 years.
docs.snippet: Economists are grappling with how much to blame bias or a changing economy for the widening wage gap over the last 40 years.
docs.lead_paragraph: William Spriggs, a professor at Howard University, wrote an open letter last year to his fellow economists. Reacting to the police killing of George Floyd in Minneapolis, he began the letter with a question: “Is now a teachable moment for economists?”

headline.main: Black Workers Stopped Making Progress on Pay. Is It Racism?
headline.print_headline: Black People Narrowed Skills Gap, But Pay Gap Persists. Is It Racism?

docs.abstract: Relatives of George Floyd said on Friday that Derek Chauvin’s prison sentence of 22 and a half years was not long enough, but that they were grateful he would face a measure of accountability after being convicted of murdering Mr. Floyd.
docs.lead_paragraph: Relatives of George Floyd said on Friday that Derek Chauvin’s prison sentence of 22 and a half years was not long enough, but that they were grateful he would face a measure of accountability after being convicted of murdering Mr. Floyd.

headline.main: George Floyd’s relatives wanted a longer sentence for Derek Chauvin but rejoiced nonetheless.
